content.question: Which of the following is most nearly the magnitude of the initial acceleration of the block, just after it is released from rest?

choices.label: <math alttext="1.0 meter per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>1.0</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="2.0 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>2.0</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="3.0 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>3.0</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="5.0 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>5.0</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1.0 meter per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>1.0</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
